title: Urea-driven g-C3N4 nanostructures for highly efficient photoreduction of Cr(VI) under visible LED light: effects of calcination temperature
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,26943-26953
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA00859F, Paper

Faramarz Safari, Reza Poursalehi, Hamid Delavari
The effectiveness of g-C3N4 samples, obtained at different calcination temperatures, was examined in the photoreduction of Cr(VI). Band positions and the Cr(VI) photoreduction mechanism of g-C3N4 are also reported.
